intro: Bletia ciliata, commonly known as the fringed bletia, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, ciliate (fringed) margins. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers with a distinct, fragrant odor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Bletia ciliata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
